heroIntro: Welcome to your next chapter on the Costa Blanca. This charming 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment in Guardamar del Segura offers the perfect blend of peaceful, relaxed lifestyle and genuine value for money. At €297,000, you're acquiring a premium specification property at 50% less than comparable homes in nearby Jávea—a testament to Guardamar's position as an increasingly popular yet undervalued destination among retirees and expat communities. With 77m² of thoughtfully designed living space, this is your gateway to year-round Mediterranean sunshine, healthcare excellence, and an authentic Spanish experience alongside a welcoming international community. Guardamar del Segura represents a rare opportunity: a coastal town that hasn't been overwhelmed by mass tourism, where you can enjoy fresh seafood at family-run chiringuitos, stroll through Blue Flag beaches, and retire with genuine peace of mind knowing quality medical facilities are minutes away. The property's premium build quality and modern amenities ensure comfortable, easy living without the inflated price tags of more famous Costa Blanca hotspots.
areaSection: Guardamar del Segura is a coastal municipality in southern Alicante, nestled between Torrevieja and the Mar Menor. This charming town of approximately 13,000 residents sits at the mouth of the Segura River, offering a distinctive geography of protected dune systems and natural salt marshes that create dramatic, ever-changing landscapes. The climate is exceptional—over 320 days of annual sunshine with mild winters and warm summers tempered by Mediterranean breezes. Unlike busier neighbouring towns, Guardamar has maintained its authentic Spanish character while quietly attracting a growing community of British, Scandinavian, and other European residents seeking genuine value and authentic coastal living. The town's strategic location provides easy access to major amenities in Torrevieja (15 minutes) and Alicante (45 minutes), while maintaining a peaceful, unhurried atmosphere that feels genuinely Spanish rather than tourist-oriented.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Guardamar del Segura revolves around genuine, unpretentious living. Your mornings might begin with a coffee at the Wednesday market, where local farmers sell fresh produce and fishmongers offer the day's catch. The expat community here is well-established but discreet—you'll find English-speaking friends at local restaurants and social groups, but without the overwhelming expat bubble of larger resorts. Beaches are your backyard: Playa Centro with its Blue Flag status, or quieter alternatives like La Roqueta and Les Ortigues, all within walking distance or a short drive. Afternoons might include a round at one of three excellent golf courses nearby, shopping at modern supermarkets (Mercadona, Lidl, Consum), or enjoying fresh seafood overlooking the water. The healthcare system is outstanding—Hospital de Torrevieja is just 15 minutes away, and local health centers provide routine care. Evenings reveal the town's culinary charm: family-run restaurants serving regional paella, fresh fish, and local wines at sensible prices. This is authentic Mediterranean retirement—not a theme park, but a real place where real people live well.
investmentSection: Guardamar del Segura represents excellent value in the Costa Blanca property market. At €3,857/m², this property commands a premium specification price yet remains 50% cheaper than equivalent properties in Jávea, while 120% above the local average—reflecting its superior build quality and ready-to-occupy status. The Costa Blanca property market has appreciated 7% year-on-year, with Guardamar experiencing above-average growth as smart buyers recognize its undervalued position. Rental potential is strong: comparable properties in this segment achieve €700+ per week during summer months, with steady demand from retirees seeking long-term rentals. Whether you're seeking a permanent retirement home or investment property with rental income potential, this apartment offers financial sensibility combined with lifestyle benefits rarely found at this price point.

You're acquiring premium-specification housing at genuine value prices, in a peaceful, welcoming town with excellent healthcare, year-round sunshine, and affordable cost of living. healthcare.text: Healthcare in Guardamar del Segura is excellent and easily accessible. Hospital de Torrevieja, located just 15 minutes away, is a modern, fully-equipped medical facility with English-speaking staff and comprehensive emergency services. The local Centro de Salud Guardamar provides routine healthcare, preventative services, and minor treatments. Numerous private clinics in the area offer specialized services with minimal waiting times. Spain's healthcare system is among Europe's best, and residents enjoy access to both public and private options. Many medical professionals speak English, and prescription medications are affordable and readily available. For retirees, this accessibility provides genuine peace of mind—quality medical care is simply part of daily life here, not a concern.

shopping.text: Shopping in Guardamar del Segura is straightforward and affordable. Modern supermarket chains including Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum provide all essentials with competitive pricing. The Wednesday market in town centre offers fresh local produce, fish, and regional specialties—a genuine social experience and excellent value. For larger shopping needs, Torrevieja (15 minutes) offers extensive retail options including department stores, fashion, and home goods. Prices are notably lower than UK equivalents, and the euro provides straightforward budgeting for retirement planning.

transport.text: Guardamar del Segura is well-connected despite maintaining a peaceful character. Alicante-Elche Airport is 45 minutes away, providing direct flights to UK, Northern Europe, and beyond—essential for retirees maintaining connections to home. Local bus services connect to Torrevieja and Alicante, though a car is recommended for maximum flexibility. The town is compact and walkable for daily shopping and beach access. Driving in Spain is straightforward for UK licence holders, and Spanish road conditions are excellent. Parking is readily available and affordable, unlike larger resort towns.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca en bra plats att köpa fastighet?
faqs.answer: Yes, particularly for retirees and early-retirement buyers. The Costa Blanca offers year-round sunshine, excellent healthcare, established expat communities, and strong property appreciation (7% year-on-year). Unlike northern European climates, you'll enjoy active outdoor living, affordable cost of living, and access to quality medical services. Guardamar del Segura specifically offers authentic Spanish living without mass-tourism overcrowding.

faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. EU and non-EU citizens can freely purchase property in Spain. You'll need an NIE (tax identification number), but this is straightforward to obtain. No special visa is required for property purchase. Our team handles all legal documentation and can recommend English-speaking solicitors familiar with international buyers. The process is transparent and well-established.

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living on the Costa Blanca is significantly lower than the UK or Northern Europe. Groceries average 30-40% less than UK prices, dining out is affordable (three-course meal €12-18), utilities are reasonable, and healthcare costs are minimal for residents. Monthly living costs for a couple in retirement typically range €1,500-2,500 depending on lifestyle. This property's location ensures budget-friendly living without sacrificing quality.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca bra för pensionärer?
faqs.answer: Excellent. The Costa Blanca is specifically designed for retirement living with healthcare excellence, warm climate, established expat communities, active leisure options (golf, beaches, dining), and affordable cost of living. Guardamar del Segura particularly suits retirees seeking authentic Spain without tourist overcrowding. The combination of medical access, climate, and lifestyle makes it ideal for retirement planning.

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional year-round. Guardamar del Segura enjoys over 320 days of annual sunshine with average temperatures of 17°C in winter and 28°C in summer. Mediterranean sea breezes keep summer temperatures comfortable, while winters are mild without harsh frost. Rainfall is minimal and seasonal. This climate eliminates concerns about seasonal depression, heating costs, or weather-related isolation common in northern climates.

faqs.question: Hur långt är det från Sverige till Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Approximately 1,200 miles (1,930 km) from southern UK. Alicante-Elche Airport (45 minutes from Guardamar) offers direct flights to UK and European destinations, with flight times of 2-2.5 hours to London and similar to other UK airports. Regular flights make visiting family straightforward, and return flights are competitively priced year-round.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically include: property tax (6-10%), legal fees (€400-800), and notary fees (€300-600). Total transaction costs average 8-12% of property price. For this €297,000 property, expect approximately €24,000-35,000 in additional costs. These are one-time expenses; ongoing costs include council tax (€300-600 annually) and minimal utilities. Mortgages are available through Spanish and international lenders.

faqs.question: Kan jag få ett bolån i Spanien som utlänning?
faqs.answer: Yes, several Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to foreign residents and non-residents. Typical LTV (loan-to-value) is 60-80%, with interest rates competitive with UK rates. Age restrictions for retirees typically extend to 75-80 years old. Our team can connect you with English-speaking mortgage advisors familiar with foreign buyer requirements. Many buyers choose cash purchases for simplicity.

faqs.question: What makes Guardamar del Segura different from other Costa Blanca towns?
faqs.answer: Guardamar maintains authentic Spanish character without mass-tourism development. It's significantly cheaper than Jávea or Denia, offers excellent beaches and golf access, and features a growing but discreet international community. The town provides genuine Mediterranean living rather than a constructed expat resort atmosphere, with local restaurants serving residents rather than tourists. This authenticity combined with value makes it increasingly attractive to discerning retirees.
